intro: Lobelia depauperata, commonly known as the poorflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, inconspicuous fruits. Lobelia depauperata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
